title: NDC Suspends 4 Amenfi Central Constituency Executives: "Anti-Party Behavior" - YEN.COM.GH
text: NDC Suspends 4 Amenfi Central Constituency Executives: "Anti-Party Behavior" - The National Democratic Congress has suspended four executives from the Amenfi Central Constituency - The four were suspended for alleged anti-party behaviour, according to a statement from the party - The suspensions are effective immediately and will last for an initial period of six months, with the possibility of an extension The [National Democratic Congress](https://yen.com.gh/tags/national-democratic-congress-ndc/) has suspended four executives from the Amenfi Central Constituency in the Western Region. According to a statement signed by the party's general secretary, the four were suspended for alleged "anti-party behaviour." [The suspended executives](https://www.myjoyonline.com/ndc-suspends-4-executives-from-amenfi-central-constituency/) are Raphael Andoh Kwaw (Constituency Chairman), Richmond Aleke (Constituency Organiser), Grace Kwaw (Women's Organiser), and Janet Fynn (Deputy Women's Organiser). [Their suspensions](https://www.graphic.com.gh/news/politics/ndc-suspends-four-amenfi-central-constituency-executives-for-anti-party-behavior.html) are effective immediately and will last for an initial period of six months, with the possibility of an extension. PAY ATTENTION: [Click “See First” under the “Following” tab to see YEN.com.gh News on your News Feed!](https://yen.com.gh/188918-new-facebook-algorithm-how-yen-news-newsfeed-now.html) The statement further clarifies that the suspended members' affiliation with the NDC is temporarily revoked, and the case will be referred to the party's National Disciplinary Committee for further investigation and potential disciplinary action. The Member of Parliament for Amenfi Central, Peter Yaw Kwakye-Ackah, has been summoned before the NDC's Political Committee. To ensure continued operations in the constituency, the party has established an interim Presidential Campaign Task Force for Amenfi Central. Nacee speaks on possible NDC appointment after producing campaign song Music producer Nacee [has revealed](https://yen.com.gh/258917-nacee-cooking-campaing-song-john-mahama-ndc-i-working.html) he is still working on his new campaign song for the National Democratic Congress. The Ghanaian gospel singer and producer also said he has no plan of accepting any political appointment. [The TGMA-nominated](https://yen.com.gh/258154-philipa-baafi-nacee-deserves-artiste-year-award-years-telecel-ghana-music-awards.html) artiste has produced other songs for the NDC in the past, such as “E dey bee,” “Onaapo,” and “Mahama Okada.” The gospel [musician](https://yen.com.gh/103623-richest-musician-africa-15-net-worth.html) previously said the campaign song had already been recorded and was waiting for the NDC to release it. NPP supporters in Volta Region begin defecting to NDC YEN.com.gh reported in a related story that some [New Patriotic Party](https://yen.com.gh/tags/npp-new-patriotic-party/) supporters in the Ketu North [have joined](https://yen.com.gh/249378-npp-supporters-volta-region-defecting-ndc-government-ruling.html) the opposition National Democratic Congress. The supporters attributed their defection to lousy governance under the Akufo-Addo administration. Some defecting supporters used to be executives of the New Patriotic Party in the constituency.
